title: 'Once a paedophile, always a paedophile': Terrified grandparents threaten to take daughter's two-year-old girl over new sex offender boyfriend
text:

A 22-year-old mother has been swept off her feet by her new boyfriend – a registered sex offender - but her parents have vowed to fight for custody if she moves in with her new man. 
Sara was convinced that her new boyfriend Matt, was innocent of his crimes, despite him having served two months in prison after being convicted of indecent assault and corruption of a minor. 
Matt insists that he's innocent to this day, and his new girlfriend Sara believes that he was wrongfully convicted and wanted helped from the Dr Phil show to prove that her boyfriend is not a liar or a sexual predator and that her two-year-old daughter will be safe. 
“One day I do hope to marry Matt,” Sara told the show, revealing that their relationship had escalated quickly. Grandparents threaten to take away child if mother moves in with convicted sex offender (Photo: drphil.com) Grandparents threaten to take away child if mother moves in with convicted sex offender (Photo: drphil.com) 
“Matt’s told me his ex-wife’s mother had a vendetta against him. The younger sister ended up testifying against Matt,” she told Dr Phil. “I do not believe he ever sexually abused anyone.” 
But Sara's parents, Anne and Dovelle, are terrified that their granddaughter will become a victim and have threatened to seek custody if Sara doesn't dump her boyfriend. 
“When I told my parents that Matt was a registered sex offender, they were very angry,” she explained. 
Of her parents trying to seek custody of her daughter, Sara said that she feels “betrayed”. Sara was confronted by her mother Anne on the Dr Phil Show over her new boyfriend Matt (Photo: drphil.com) 
“I really wish they would back off when it comes to my relationships and how I raise my daughter,” she said. 
“I could never imagine Matt groping or harming my child and if I did that, he would never be around her. Matt and I are considering moving in together,” she said. 
Sara's mother Anne claimed her daughter was being “reckless”, and said: “I am terrified of my granddaughter being around him.” 
Anne said that after he was convicted by a judge that's game over: “Once you're a paedophile, you're always a paedophile.” Matt has to register as a sex offender for the rest of his life (Photo: drphil.com) 
While her father Dovell said: “I am very protective of my granddaughter. If I ever found out that Matt hurt my granddaughter, I would drive to his house, kick his door in – and there would be no saving him.” 
He also added that Sara has to break up with Matt: “And if she doesn’t, I will see her in court for custody of my granddaughter.” 
Matt, who has two ex-wives and three children, insists that he's innocent of charges that he groped a minor six years ago. 
He said: “I absolutely did not molest my ex-wife’s sister.” Matt's reaction to his victim's phone call (Photo: drphil.com) 
Anne says she’s furious that Sara is considering moving in with Matt. “If she moves in with him without him being cleared of these charges, I will file for custody of that child.” 
“If I’m wrong then it will be completely over… completely,” Sara said. 
Dr Phil said that the main concern is for the two-year-old daughter. 
“This has nothing to do with whether he’s guilty or not,” Dr Phil said. “If you are a single mother cohabitating with a male, the risk of a child being sexually abused is 20 times normal – that doesn’t necessarily mean by the male you’re living with.” 
During the show, Matt was confronted by his victim, who was his former wife’s (then) 14-year-old sister, who said that she was willing to take a polygraph to prove she was telling the truth. Like us on Facebook
